meanings.definition: A short, high-pitched sound made by a bird or insect.
meanings.sent1: The little bird let out a chirp in the morning.
meanings.sent2: I heard the chirp of a cricket in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The chirp of the bird woke me up with its cheerful melody.
meanings.sent4: The chirp of the cricket filled the night with music.
meanings.sent5: The chirp of the robin was like a tiny bell ringing in the air.

meanings.definition: To make a short, high-pitched sound.
meanings.sent1: The bird will chirp when it sees its friend.
meanings.sent2: I chirp to imitate the sound of a cricket.
meanings.sent3: I chirp happily when I see my favorite food.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter made her chirp with joy.
meanings.sent5: The children chirp with excitement as they play in the park.

meanings.definition: A short, high-pitched sound made by electronic devices.
meanings.sent1: The alarm clock let out a loud chirp to wake me up.
meanings.sent2: I heard a chirp coming from my phone when I received a message.
meanings.sent3: The chirp of the microwave signaled that my popcorn was ready.
meanings.sent4: The chirp of the smoke detector startled the cat.
meanings.sent5: The chirp of the computer indicated a new email had arrived.
